selectionObj.name: display a value in CSS log

selectionObj.name: ParameterBanker was moved
selectionObj.desc: ParameterBanker was moved

selectionObj.name: set value
selectionObj.desc: Value between the parameter's min and max values. Min/Max values can be different depending on the parameter. You can find out the min/max values for a specific parameter by logging them to the CSS log. Add the following Action: Misc > Display a value in CSS log. Select device parameter max / min.

parameterObj.name: Number (Float)
parameterObj.desc: A decimal number value i.e. 0.8, 128.10 etc

value_range.name: number of steps
value_range.desc: How many steps should the ranges have between their min and max values?

value_range.name: Round down
value_range.desc: If 'current input value' is between 2 steps then if set to 'yes' it will round down to closest step (rounds up by default)

value_range.name: log data
value_range.desc: output data in the log window (Note: only turn on while testing and clear the log often)

value_range.name: current input value
value_range.desc: the value which the input range is currently set as

value_range.name: input min
value_range.desc: Set the minimum value for the input range

value_range.name: input max
value_range.desc: Set the maximum value for the input range

value_range.name: input decimal places
value_range.desc: set the decimal place limit for input range values

value_range.name: output min
value_range.desc: Set the minimum value for the output range

selectionObj.name: min
selectionObj.desc: The lower value of the allowed range forthis parameter

value_range.name: output max
value_range.desc: Set the maximum value for the output range

selectionObj.name: max
selectionObj.desc: The upper value of the allowed range for this parameter

value_range.name: output decimal places
value_range.desc: Set the decimal place limit for output range values

value_range.name: reverse output range
value_range.desc: Reverse the direction of the output range. It will instead go from max to min

selectionObj.name: exit reaction here
selectionObj.desc: Immediately exit the reaction at this point.

selectionObj.name: Custom
selectionObj.desc: Enter custom input
selectionObj.notes: this is the only true custom field. Can be used to add mixes of variables, function calls... whatever.

extraFields.name: Custom
extraFields.desc: Can be Python code, text, numbers. If using text, wrap it in "quotations".

actions.full_code:
from types import MethodType
def send_midi(self, msg):
  self._send_midi(msg)
self.send_midi = MethodType(send_midi, self)

selectionObj.name: script is initialised
selectionObj.desc: When the script is first initialised, note: this listener is not mode specific (it will always fire when the script is loaded regardless of the active mode)

selectionObj.desc: Immediately exit the reaction at this point.

actions.full_code:
tempo_text = str(int(self.song().tempo))  # Convert tempo float → string
sysex_temp = tuple([240, 126, 6] + [ord(c) for c in tempo_text] + [247])
self._send_midi(sysex_temp)
